content.description:
easily the best route in the cave.

fun, tricky, and dynamic movement. a knee pad proved useful.

not sure if the top has been opened yet, but ending on karma police adds another cruxy move and some good pulling.
content.protection: fixed gear + 1 draw for the headwall. no anchor.
content.location: the left of the two longer routes in the middle of the cave. walk off the top.

content.description: Bouldery start onto small ledge, (stick clip first bolt). Work through somewhat funky rock to crack/seam then straight up to anchors.
content.location: Currently the 2nd route encountered while hiking along base from the left, down about 30 yards from Powder Finger.

content.description: essentially a right hand start to 'karma police'. climbs a short boulder problem then moves directly into the crux section of 'karma'. maybe not as good because it skips the fun intro to karma, but still worth doing.
content.protection: you'll need 3-4 draws, i couldn't afford chain draws to leave on the route. extending the draw on karma police where the routes link up helps reduce drag dramatically (easy to do with a stick clip).
content.location: starts on a horn in between karma police and los adalberto's especial. links into karma police.

content.description:
fun, popular route. great movement.

some trickery has discovered knee pads to be useful.
content.protection: fixed gear, bring draws for the last two bolts. has anchors
content.location: on the right side of the cave, next to the big bush. directly left of 'the hive'.

content.description: Work up small flake to big holds, lieback on positive holds to great pocketed short upper section to anchors. A very fun routeÂ…just wish it was twice as long.
content.location: First route on the far left side of the wall.

content.description:
start as for 'el jefe', bust right after the crux along the rail to the hole on 'riff raff', then continue up 'riff'.

a fun link up, worth a go really.

sequential and powerful, has a bolt in the very back of the cave for the belayer. merges left into karma police at the top. feels noticeably harder than everything else in the cave.

the poopy hole may need cleaned out from time to time, but if you're on this route before/after birds take up residence, it should stay clean.
content.protection: fixed gear. stick clip, a draw for the start. no anchor.
content.location: right of karma police, starts on a flat hold to the left of the bush. clip the belayer into the bolt on the very back wall.

content.description: beta intensive, bouldery roof climbing. some holds have been taken over by bird nests.
content.protection: fixed gear. no anchor. need one draw for the first bolt, and one for the headwall.
content.location: the middle line of the longer routes in the cave proper. directly right of 'wave'. walk off. (it's easy to get the last draw back.)

content.description:
Bouldery start to underclings on small roof. Use crack through roof to get over roof to crimps then massive jugs. Finishes on sharp pockets with a couple of powerful moves to the anchors.

The routes name comes from a bee hive located in a pod just left of the route.
content.location: Currently rightmost route at the cave, just to the right of Crank Addiction.

content.description:
a decent warm-up for the main cave. grovel at the lip...

once the trickery is learned, it doesn't feel hard anymore.

has been done without the tram start, but it's not really worth doing.
content.protection: fixed gear. two draws for headwall. has anchors.
content.location: found to the right of 'bride'. tram start to first bolt, long chain draw.

content.description: Scramble through loose section to 1st bolt and jugs. Then proceed up overhang to sharp, but massive jugs. Keep powering as the route veers right and then straight up to anchors.
content.location: Located in the central part of the cave, to the left of the seriously overhung route Karma Police, .13c. Look for the big jug at the 3 bolt that looks like the jug puked a bunch of bird shit!

content.description: Either start left of the first bolt or winch start to the first bolt. Move diagonally right to crux at bolt 4. Good pockets up top.

Chossy climbing to the first bolt, then brilliant horizontal moves on jugs. difficult crux pulling the lip.

Some say it's soft for the grade.
